meanings.definition: To cite as evidence or proof.
meanings.sent1: She adduces her research findings to support her argument.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer adduces the witness's testimony in court.
meanings.sent3: He adduces his love for ice cream as a reason to eat it every day.
meanings.sent4: The detective adduces the fingerprints on the weapon as a clue to the crime.
meanings.sent5: The scientist adduces the data from the experiment to draw conclusions.

meanings.definition: To bring forward or present as support.
meanings.sent1: The student adduces examples from the text to explain his answer.
meanings.sent2: The manager adduces the sales report to justify the budget increase.
meanings.sent3: She adduces her cat's purring as a sign of approval for her cooking.
meanings.sent4: The artist adduces the use of color to enhance the mood of the painting.
meanings.sent5: The chef adduces the fresh ingredients as the secret to his delicious dishes.
